intro: Chenolea pentagona, commonly known as the five-angled chenolea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal leaves, which are often covered in a fine layer of white powder. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Chenolea pentagona is primarily valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
